title: California Code of Civil Procedure § 337
text: Within four years: An action upon any contract, obligation or liability founded upon an instrument in writing.

title: California Code of Civil Procedure § 339
text: Within two years: An action upon a contract, obligation or liability not founded upon an instrument of writing.

title: California Commercial Code – Division 2 (UCC Article 2)
text: Division 2 governs contracts for the sale of goods, including formation, performance, and remedies.

title: Uniform Commercial Code § 2-201 (Statute of Frauds)
text: A contract for the sale of goods for $500 or more is not enforceable unless there is a sufficient signed writing.

title: Uniform Commercial Code § 2-715 (Buyer’s Incidental and Consequential Damages)
text: Defines incidental and consequential damages recoverable by a buyer for a seller’s breach.

title: Federal Arbitration Act
text: Provides for the validity, irrevocability, and enforcement of written arbitration agreements.

title: SBA Business Loans
text: Regulations governing SBA loan programs, borrower obligations, lender oversight, and enforcement.

title: Contract Disputes Act of 1978
text: Establishes the framework and procedures for resolving claims relating to federal government contracts.

title: E-SIGN Act
text: Ensures the validity and legal effect of electronic signatures and electronic records in interstate commerce.

title: California Small Claims Act (Jurisdiction & Procedure)
text: Governs California small claims actions, including jurisdictional limits, filing, and procedure.

title: Delaware Limited Liability Company Act
text: Governs formation, operating agreements, fiduciary duties, and dispute resolution for Delaware LLCs.

title: Texas Property Code – Commercial Landlord-Tenant (general)
text: Texas statutes governing landlord-tenant relations, including remedies and procedures relevant to commercial leases.

title: California Civil Code § 3300 (Damages for Breach of Contract)
text: For the breach of an obligation arising from contract, the measure of damages ... is the amount which will compensate the party aggrieved for all the detriment proximately caused thereby.

title: Federal Trade Commission Act (unfair or deceptive acts)
text: Prohibits unfair or deceptive acts or practices in commerce; occasionally implicated alongside contract claims.

title: California Civil Code § 1950.5 (Residential security deposits)
text: Residential security deposits: 21-day return deadline; itemized statement; limited permissible deductions (rent, cleaning to original level, repair beyond normal wear). Bad-faith retention may trigger statutory damages up to twice the deposit.

title: California Civil Code § 1950.7 (Commercial security deposits)
text: Commercial security deposits: accounting and return obligations for commercial tenancies; governs lawful deductions and timing.

title: California Small Claims Jurisdiction
text: Small-claims jurisdictional limits and eligibility for filing.
